item.description:
Country fried bacon. Duck fat French fries. Macaroni and cheese with lobster, Taleggio and black truffles. Decadence reigns at Hartford'sBurger Baby, which opened earlier this month in the former Mayor Mike's at 283 Asylum Street.

The area's newest burger joint melds elements of fine dining and comfort food, under the direction of executive chef Matt Hauschild. Featured starters like Parmesan foam-topped hand-cut fries, roasted pork belly in a cider-grape reduction and seared rare tuna join timeless classics like fried pickles, matzo ball soup and Asian popcorn chicken.

Burgers (five- or seven-ounce patties) are ground from a blend of Porterhouse, Angus and chuck, served on grilled brioche buns with organic Boston bibb lettuce and marinated tomatoes. Specialty burgers include the Big Cheese (Taleggio-stuffed with pickled shallots,) Fire (hot smoked paprika, sauteed chilis, chipotle aioli) and the Meatloaf, with applewood smoked bacon, crispy onions and house-made ketchup glaze.

The premium Wagyu burger, with 7 ounces of American Kobe beef and black truffle aioli ($14.95) has an optional foie gras add-on ($6.) Non-beef eaters can choose from veggie, ahi tuna, lamb and turkey options, as well as a lobster BLT with Meyer lemon aioli.

Chefs' specialties include larger plates like short-rib macaroni and cheese, grilled hanger steak, roasted chicken and seared sea scallops.

Playful indulgences extend to the beverages, with boozy "spirited shakes" and alcoholic ice cream floats with beer, vodka and rum, along with creative cocktails.

Join us at this new venue...let's check it out. I'll be there for Happy Hour at 5pm- but you can come anytime. Happy Hour ends at 6pm...we will be having dinner at 6:30pm. C'mon out!!!
